description: On March 9, as a set of recomendations on how to prevent infections of Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) in educational environments, colombian goverment stated that educational institutions must keep students, administrative personnel or teachers with flu-like illnesses separated from those who are healthy until they can go home. It is recommended to keep more than two meters of distance.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education

description: On March 18 2020, the Ministry of the Interior of Colombia issued decree number 420 of 2020 which enable majors to issued curfew for children and adolescents, from March 18 2020 to April 20, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Colombia (cali) will start "pico y cedular" in cali starting April 6.This decision seeks to have the population shop in shifts in supermarkets, and commercial and banking establishments, with the repeated call to the people of Valle del Cauca to keep the coronavirus in isolation.

On March 18 2020, the Ministry of the Interior of Colombia issued decree number 420 of 2020 where it informs that the mayors of children and adolescents, from March 18 2020 to April 20, 2020.

On 12th Abril the Colombian government announced that a new curfew restriction would be taking place from the 20th April to 26th April. The new measurement was targeted to over 18 years old and the restriction were based on the last digit of their ID number. UPDATE: The original policy was set to last until 20th abril and It was targeted to children. The new curfew "Pico y Cedula / Pico y Genero"  is targeted to people over 18 years, this policy was set up to finish on 26th April.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Colombia anounced the health emergency on March 11

Colombia (Bogota) announced yellow alert which is legally binding on both the public and private sectors. Starting tomorrow (12. March), we will issue a decree that will be valid for two months. We are in a mode of changing our daily habits to take care of ourselves and those around us," announced the mayor.
Colombia took the decision to decree a State of Emergency, in accordance with Article 215 of the Political Constitution of Colombia.

Colombia took the decision to decree a State of Emergency, in accordance with Article 215 of the Political Constitution of Colombia.
The state of emergency was extended in May to last until Augost 31
 UPDATE: The original state of emergency was set to last until May 31, it has been extended to Augost 31
On November 25th, Colombia announced a health emergency until February 28th, encouraging people to continue social distancing and isolation measures.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Colombia  suspended transit and disembarkation of cruise ships in Colombia on March. 11(resolution 385 of 2020).
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Colombia is colsing the border crossings with Venezuela as a protection measure in view of the situation in the neighbouring country. 
Restricting the entry into the country of persons who are neither citizens nor residents and who have been in Europe and Asia during the last 14 days. Colombians who have been in these places will be subject to mandatory preventive isolation and all controls to ensure compliance with the measures.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Colombia decided to close all land, sea and river borders in the country. Colombia's borders will be closed from 17 March 2020 until 30 May on all passengers.
This border closure will restrict the entry and exit of all national and foreign citizens from the country. During the border closure, cargo transport will be allowed for the entry and exit of products through the authorized land points. 
As of March 16, the entry of non-nationals and non-residents of Colombia into the country is restricted. All Colombian passengers and foreign residents will have mandatory preventive isolation for 14 days. UPDATE: All borders are closed completly now, before only Venezuela & cruise. Restrict the entry and exit of all national and foreign citizens
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Colombia is enforcing  restricted entry to any international traveler (all passeners, inclusing colombian natinoals)  to Colombia, regardless of their origin or background starting March 23
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Colombia (Cali) is closing the border to Ecuador starting April 22
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Colombia is not allowing any international flights for its citizens until August 31st, starting on June 1st.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Colombia is enforcing the use of masks for everyone who has simtoms of corona/flu, in the case you have had contact to a confirmed corona case and for medical staff/persons in contact with persons with symptoms at workon Feb. 25.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Colombia is granting life insurance coverage to 585,000 health workers, covering those who die as a result of COVID-19. It is free of charge, no pre-existence, no age limit, no income requirement, and no limit to time of stay. It covers retroactively as of March 2nd until December 31st. It will be administered by FASECOLDA through private insurers.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Colombia announced on March 18 that additional resources areallocated to the health system to facilitate the acquisition of medical equipment, have greater testing capabilities available and provide liquidity resource. 
Accelerate the necessary mechanisms for the implementation of the end point scheme to inject liquidity and pay off historical debts of the health system, guaranteeing the operation of the network and the arrival of the necessary technologies to care for the most critical patients.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Colombia has implemented the following procedures for domestic flights: Passengers must arrive two hours in advance of their flight's scheduled time with electronic check-up when possible; Passengers must carry only personal bags that can be stored under the passenger's chair, all others must be checked; It will be recommended to make use of the CoronApp-Colombia app to keep health information; Certain airports will have restricted admissions for workers only; All people entering the airport will have their temperature taken with a contactless thermometer; All persons must use personal protective equipment; Passengers arriving at the air terminals for flights should immediately go to the boarding rooms; Workers will clean up all areas; Passenger registration will be taken at the pre-boarding stage; All are required to respect the physical distancing of 2 meters in areas such as counters, scanners and in the queues for aircraft boarding; Boarding will be authorized only when the aircraft is ready; The aircraft will not be serviced on board; Passengers not to use onboard entertainment systems such as screens and mobile phones; Aircraft bathrooms should not be used if possible; Passengers must remain seated during the flight; All airport and airline personnel will be trained to identify biological hazard situations; Passengers given directions for disembarkation; Passengers must go directly to exit; Passengers must report symptoms within 14 days. Starts on July 1st.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Colombia is enforcing Telework or work from home For working public servants who have recently arrived from a country with an incidence of COVID-19 cases Who have been in contact with patients diagnosed with COVID-19. For those with mild and moderate respiratory symptoms, without abandoning their position
It is important to clarify that each employer is responsible for taking action to this effect and it will be the responsibility of the teleworker to comply with this measure in order to make it effective, in terms of preventive social . Face-to-face meetings or concentration of several people in reduced work spaces with low ventilation, to avoid the risk of contagion of respiratory diseases and COVID-19 by close contact on March 13.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: Colombia announced a ban on the consumption of alcoholic beverages, crowded meetings staring March 19. That the consumption of intoxicating beverages in open spaces and commercial establishments be prohibited. The sale of intoxicating beverages is NOT prohibited.

description: Colombia (Cali) is enforcing ley seca (dry law). It is the restriction that limits or prohibits the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages on special days, usually days when there are major scheduled events such as public elections, or when there is a threat of political or sporting unrest that would arouse deep-seated rivalry. Starting April 30 until may 4

Colombia (Cali) is enforcing ley seca (dry law). It is the restriction that limits or prohibits the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages on special days, usually days when there are major scheduled events such as public elections, or when there is a threat of political or sporting unrest that would arouse deep-seated rivalry. Starting April 30 until may 4

Colombia's Ministry of Health and Social Protection implemented biosecurity protocols so that hairdressers, beauty salons, barbershops and related can operate. Scheduled appointments will be required to monitor capacity, customers will need their temperatures taken and must be asked about possible symptoms, a distance of two meters must be maintained between vanities, the use of Personal Protection Equipment is mandatory and employees must be equipped with gowns, head caps, safety goggles, plastic mask and disposable gloves. Disinfectant use is expected, and tools are recommended to be disposable. This goes into effect on June 16th.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Personal Grooming Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Colombia announced that from March 14 to April 30, 2020 there will be total closure of cultural spaces throughout the country. On the same dates, virtual activities related to the collections and cultural services will be programmed, but not activities in the physical spaces.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: Colombia will be allowing the reopening of museums with the following restrictions starting June 16th: virtual payments must be enabled, capacity restrictions must be in place, social distancing must occur, health-related materials or trained staff must communicate recommendations for health and safety upon entry, and hand sanitizer must be available (60% to 90% alcohol).
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Colombia is enforcung that Companies and workplaces should organize work at home for as many employees as possible. For employees who are required to attend the workplace, at least 3 entry and exit shifts should be organised throughout the working day.
In addition to work at home and shift work, universities and colleges should organize the virtualization of as many classes and activities as possible. To postpone any public or private event of massive concentration, of more than 1,000 people, in close contact, that is to say less than 2 meters. All stations and buses in the system will be not only washed but also disinfected daily. Randomly during the day, stations and buses will be disinfected at off-peak hours. All schools and public establishments must wash and disinfect their common areas daily.
 Priority will be given to initial home care of patients infected with COVID19 . This will be done in order to avoid congestion in the health and emergency services and reduce the risk of contagion. The Ministry of Health and the four health sub-networks in Bogot will organize home delivery of medicines, so that patients with chronic diseases will not have to go to hospitals to pick them up. Public and private health service providers will make joint purchases of mouthwash, gel, alcohol and other supplies to avoid stock-outs and organize adequate distribution.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: In Colombia the Ministry of Education authorizes Schools and Universities to use on-line tools until May 30/2020. UPDATE: The use of on-line tools for the development of academic programs with qualified registration in face-to-face mode during the period of the health emergency, that is, between March 12 and May 30, 2020, does not imply a change in the program modality.

Colombia (Bogot) recommends to cancel every event with more than 500 people. Addtionally, it is recommended to have 1,5m distance between everyone and to realize everything in an open space announced on March 13.

Colombian colleges and universities will continue to host courses online only until reconsideration on August 1st. UPDATE: In-person courses at universities and colleges will be continue to be conducted online until reconsideration on August 1st; this has been in place since March 16th.

Colombia (Bogota) recommend owners of discotheques, religious congregations, theatres, movie theatres, cultural venues and other activities that agglomerate less than 500 people, to evaluate the possibility of postponing them until the health authorities report that the epidemiological risk has been overcome. Bogota suspend attention in ICBF gardens, as well as classes in public and private schools in the country. Parents who can't virtually download the guidebooks can go to the school to physically claim them. Also school feeding, this will NOT be suspended. It was also clarified that the food can be collected between Wednesday and Friday. Bogot is demanding the habitants to stay home and do only the necessary UPDATE: Recomendation of mass gathering has been restricted to max 500 people
Colombia is enforcing a ban on meetings and gatherings of more than 50 people
In Colombia (Bogota) the Major restricts the transit of people by gender, on odd days female allowed, and on even days males allowed, effective from April 13 until April 26 (Midnight)
Colombian mass public transport cannot exceed an occupancy of 35% of its capacity.
Group exercise and sports practice in public places is not allowed. Swimming pools and sports centers can only be used for sports on an individual basis by professional and high performance athletes.

In the Colombian cultural field, theatres will only be used for creative, artistic activities of the performing arts, without at any time allowing the entry of public or the realization of group activities that generate agglomeration.

Colombian is enforcing the restriction of activities in the following areas: Bars, nightclubs, casinos, billiards, gambling establishments, gyms, swimming pools, spas, saunas, sports courts/centers, amusement parks and playgrounds. This will last until July 1st starting June 1st.

On March 9, 2020, as a set of recomendations on how to prevent infections of Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) in educational environments, colombian goverment stated that children over 3 years of age, from the onset of respiratory symptoms, should wear masks and, if possible, should not attend school.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
